node.title: 'We desperately need a bigger harvest in 2022' - NZ Winegrowers
node.description: The first grapes of the 2022 vintage have been picked and winegrowers are hoping for good yields as they try to replenish their cellars.

node.title: Soon only one U.S. state will still have indoor mask rules
node.description: More parts of the country are dropping mask requirements, signaling a new phase in the pandemic.

node.title: Some LGBTQ Ukrainians fear abuse if Russia invades: "We will fight"
node.description: Russia "won't allow us to exist peacefully and to fight for our rights as we are able to do that in Ukraine right now," an 18-year-old law student said.

node.title: Prosecutors threatened to charge Trump Org. CFO's son, lawyers say
node.description: Attorneys claim the Manhattan D.A. "threatened to prosecute" Allen Weisselberg's son because of "Weisselberg's decision not to cooperate" with investigators.

node.title: Altruism in birds? Magpies have outwitted scientists
node.description: When we attached tiny, backpack-like tracking devices to five Australian magpies for a pilot study, we didn't expect to discover an entirely new social behaviour rarely seen in birds, Dominique Potvin… Video

node.title: Auckland restaurants struggle to stay open amid Omicron surge
node.description: Empty streets, closed signs decorating windows and locked gates are all signs of Omicron and the red traffic light setting in Tāmaki Makaurau. Audio

node.title: Concern Parliament protest becoming 'free-for-all'
node.description: Misinformation researchers are concerned the protest at Parliament is becoming a "free-for-all" as the idea of any leadership within the blockade area slips away.

node.title: Biden announces sanctions against company behind Nord Stream 2
node.description: President Biden said the U.S. will "not hesitate to take further steps if Russia continues to escalate."

node.title: Police "inundated" with calls about 500-pound bear "Hank the Tank"
node.description: Locals are contemplating whether to have the bear killed, but police stressed that "no one wants to see him euthanized."

node.title: 'Collective cry for help' as St John staff shortages take ambulances out of action
node.description: Staff shortages forced up to nine ambulances off the road in Auckland on Saturday night, as Omicron takes its toll on paramedics. Audio

node.title: Crusaders coach preparing for Covid cases, offers support to Moana Pasifika
node.description: Crusaders coach Scott Robertson says it's inevitable that other Super Rugby Pacific teams will have positive Covid cases.

node.title: 'There will be war' - Ukrainians in NZ say govt must act
node.description: Ukrainians here worry they may never see their family back home again and say the government here must join the West and impose sanctions on Russia. Audio

node.title: Police and Parliament protesters in late-night stand-off
node.description: Police and protesters were in a stand-off on Hill Street near Parliament late on Wednesday night.

node.title: "Magical": NFL player took girl whose dad died to father-daughter dance
node.description: "It sort of gave us a little bit of joy and light at the end of a very dark tunnel. It was just a magical experience for everybody," Audrey Soape's mother said.

node.title: Baltimore program helps single moms, daughters build stronger bonds
node.description: In addition to mentorship programs that focus on social-emotional needs, BOND also offers a financial wellness curriculum built by and for women of color.

node.title: Belarus' other border crisis
node.description: Its border with Ukraine is under constant watch, but a few months ago, Belarus' border with Poland was the center of a migrant crisis.

node.title: Mayor Eric Adams faces criticism from LGBTQ community over recent appointments
node.description: Members of the city council's LGBTQ caucus want Adams to reconsider appointing Fernando Cabrera.

node.title: Screaming Trees frontman Mark Lanegan dies aged 57
node.description: Screaming Trees frontman and former Queens of the Stone Age member died at his home in Killarney, Ireland, a statement on his Twitter account said.

node.title: Houston communities may lose homes due to freeway expansion
node.description: The freeway-widening project is threatening to disrupt the lives of thousands of people, most of them from communities of color.

node.title: Refining New Zealand posts $552m loss
node.description: The refinery will start winding down production in March and become a giant storage facility for imported processed fuel brought in by the fuel companies.

node.title: 'Supply dynamics tight': Sharp rise in Steel & Tube profit despite pandemic pressures
node.description: The building boom and rising prices and margins have delivered a tripling of Steel and Tube's half year profit.

node.title: OCR raised by a quarter of a percentage point to 1 percent
node.description: The Reserve Bank has resumed its battle with surging inflation by raising the official cash rate and has signalled more rises this year.

node.title: 'No one wants to come into town': Businesses increasingly frustrated at protest
node.description: Wellington businesses are becoming increasingly impatient at the demonstration that's sucking foot traffic away from them. Audio

node.title: Chiefs given all clear to leave Super Rugby bubble, other teams set to head home
node.description: Queenstown's Super Rugby bubble is about to burst.

node.title: Former SBA President Ed Mullins surrenders to authorities
node.description: His surrender comes five months after the FBI raided his home and office​.

node.title: Girl beings note to school, leading police to find boy's body in freezer
node.description: Police found the boy's remains after a girl took a note to school in which the mother said she was being held against her will.

node.title: Covid-19 death rate 17 times higher among unvaccinated than vaxxed, Fiji govt warns
node.description: Fiji Government warns unvaccinated people in the vaccine-eligible population are 17 times more likely to die if they contract Covid-19 than those that are vaccinated.

node.title: Wall Street rebounds as ground situation in Ukraine intensifies
node.description: Analysts warn of "significant scope for equities to fall" should crisis in Ukraine escalate into military conflict.

node.title: Ex-cheerleader convicted after beer can DNA linked to killings of 3 women
node.description: Prosecutors will seek the death penalty for Robert Hayes during the sentencing phase beginning next week.

node.title: Putin has U.N. chief worried about "perversion" of peacekeeping idea
node.description: With member nations set to discuss the crisis on Russia and Ukraine's borders, Kyiv's envoy and the U.N. secretary-general say the global organization is facing a crucial test.
